meanings.definition: To remove part or all of the liver surgically.
meanings.sent1: The doctor hepatectomized the patient to save their life.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon will hepatectomize the diseased portion of the liver.
meanings.sent3: After the hepatectomy, the patient felt relieved and hopeful.
meanings.sent4: The liver transplant was like a hepatectomy for the old, damaged organ.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the hepatectomy equipment echoed in the operating room.

meanings.definition: Having undergone a surgical removal of part or all of the liver.
meanings.sent1: The hepatectomized patient followed a strict recovery plan.
meanings.sent2: She was a hepatectomized survivor with a new lease on life.
meanings.sent3: The hepatectomized individual had a unique perspective on health.
meanings.sent4: His hepatectomized liver was a symbol of resilience and strength.
meanings.sent5: The hepatectomized organ was a testament to modern medical advancements.
